result.execSummary:
All charges against Dan W Lash in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dan W Lash is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dan W Lash

defendant.name: Lash, Dan W

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
State advises Court that defendant is not competent and not likely to regain within the statutory time limits; they have contacted the victim.
For reasons stated on the record, State's motion to dismiss this case.

Court grants State's motion and orders case dismissed without prejudice.  Defendant is released from all conditions of bail.

Clerk:  jms
Competency hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court.  Patrick J Anderson, appearing for Dennis Murphy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.
State is contesting the findings of the doctor's report.
Court orders case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 28.

Forensics contacted regarding Dr. Collins' availability for the next court date.
Court approves defendant's appearance via Zoom video for the next court date.

Clerk:  jms
from Deborah L. Collins, Psy.D., ABPP dated March 24, 2022 - received
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 04-01-2022 at 1:30pm in Branch 37

Defendant Dan W Lash in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter via Zoom. Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Dan W Lash not in court.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Zoe Plovanich informed the court that her client is at the VA hospital. Warrant was canceled and stayed until the next court appearance 2/23/2022, at 1:30 p.m.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
